item.title: 消息人士称，日本央行将在结束YCC后就债券购买步伐提供指引
item.description: 四位熟悉日本央行想法的消息人士称，日本央行可能会就结束负利率和收益率曲线控制（YCC）后将购买多少政府债券提供数字指导，以避免造成市场混乱。【原文：The Bank of Japan will likely offer numerical guidance on how much government bonds it will buy upon ending negative interest rates and yield curve control (YCC), to avoid causing market disruptions, said four sources familiar with its thinking.】

item.title: 大多数韩国央行董事会成员认为政策转向为时尚早 - 会议纪要
item.description: 周二的会议纪要显示，在2月22日举行的利率决策会议上，大多数韩国央行董事会成员都表示，现在调整货币政策还为时过早，因为决策者仍将稳定物价放在首位。【原文：Most Bank of Korea board members said it was too early for a pivot in monetary policy at their rate decision meeting on Feb. 22, minutes showed on Tuesday, as policymakers continued to prioritise stabilising prices.】

item.title: 多米诺比萨集团因成本缓解而利润增加
item.description: 英国多米诺比萨集团（Domino's Pizza Group）周二发布报告称，受原材料成本下降的支撑，该集团 2023 年的利润将略有增长，并预计本年度的利润将符合预期。【原文：Britain's Domino's Pizza Group on Tuesday reported a marginal rise in its 2023 profit, and also forecast profit for the current year to be in line with expectations, supported by the easing of raw material costs.】

item.title: 独家报道中国总理李克强将不出席重要商业峰会与全球首席执行官会面
item.description: 三位知情人士透露，中国国务院总理李强不打算在即将于 3 月下旬举行的中国发展高层论坛（CDF）上与来访的外国首席执行官会面。【原文：Chinese Premier Li Qiang does not intend to hold a meeting with visiting foreign CEOs at the upcoming China Development Forum (CDF) in late March, three sources briefed on the matter said, raising concerns about Beijing's commitment to attract investment from abroad at a time of souring sentiment.】

item.title: 保时捷预计 2024 年回报率将随着新车型的推出而降低
item.description: 德国豪华汽车制造商保时捷周二表示，尽管市场波动较大，但该公司发布的全年业绩基本符合预期。【原文：German luxury carmaker Porsche expects profitability to tick downwards in 2024 as it focuses on launching four new models, the company said on Tuesday, posting full-year results largely in line with expectations despite market volatility.】

item.title: 特斯拉称德国工厂全面恢复生产尚需时日
item.description: 特斯拉位于柏林附近的德国千兆工厂负责人安德烈-蒂埃里希（Andre Thierig）周一晚些时候表示，该工厂还需要一段时间才能完全恢复生产。【原文：It will take some time until production at Tesla's German gigafactory near Berlin will fully resume, plant head Andre Thierig said late on Monday.】

item.title: 独家报道消息称中国体操冠军李宁考虑将公司私有化
item.description: 中国亿万富翁、奥运冠军李宁正在考虑将其同名运动服装公司从香港证券交易所私有化。【原文：Chinese billionaire entrepreneur and Olympic champion Li Ning is considering taking his namesake sportswear company private from the Hong Kong stock exchange, four people said, adding to a string of such potential deals in a faltering market.】

item.title: 欧洲 英镑多头为英国工资测试做好准备
item.description: 安库尔-班纳吉（Ankur Banerjee）对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Ankur Banerjee】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，加拿大国家银行考虑出售柬埔寨分行
item.description: 据彭博社周二援引知情人士的话报道，加拿大国民银行正在为其柬埔寨分行 ABA Bank 寻求各种选择，包括以超过 20 亿美元的价格出售该银行。【原文：National Bank of Canada is exploring options for its Cambodian unit ABA Bank, including its sale for more than $2 billion in a deal, Bloomberg reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 特斯拉和竞争对手的自动驾驶技术得分较低
item.description: 在本周二发布的一份新研究报告中，特斯拉的自动驾驶和完全自动驾驶技术以及主要汽车制造商销售的其他九种辅助驾驶系统获得了美国公路安全保险协会的 "差 "评。【原文：Tesla's Autopilot and Full Self Driving technology and nine other assisted-driving systems marketed by major automakers received "poor" ratings from the U.S. Insurance Institute for Highway Safety in a new study released on Tuesday.】

item.title: 据《纽约时报》报道，美国联邦航空局（FAA）对波音 737 MAX 生产的审计发现了数十个问题
item.description: 据《纽约时报》周一报道，美国联邦航空管理局（FAA）对波音公司的 737 MAX 生产流程进行了审计，因为 1 月份阿拉斯加航空公司一架喷气式飞机上的一块面板被炸掉，在 89 项测试中，有 33 项没有通过。【原文：The Federal Aviation Administration's (FAA) audit of Boeing's 737 MAX production process after a panel blew off an Alaska Airlines jet in January failed 33 of 89 tests, The New York Times reported on Monday.】

item.title: 据彭博社报道，日本电产和 KPS 竞争西门子价值 30 亿美元的 Innomotics 部门
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周一报道，日本日本电产公司（Nidec Corp）和美国私募股权公司 KPS Capital Partners 正在竞争收购西门子公司的 Innomotics 大型电机业务。【原文：Japan's Nidec Corp and U.S.-based private equity firm KPS Capital Partners are competing to acquire Siemens AG's Innomotics large motors business, Bloomberg News reported on Monday.】

item.title: 美国消费者物价指数公布前亚洲股市上涨；日元因日本央行言论而走高
item.description: 周二，在颇具影响力的美国通胀报告公布前，亚洲股市微幅走高，而日本股市下跌，日元走强，原因是市场对日本央行可能最早于下周退出超宽松货币政策的预期升温。【原文：Asian stocks nudged higher on Tuesday ahead of the influential U.S. inflation report, while Japanese shares fell and the yen firmed on rising expectations that the Bank of Japan may be ready to exit ultra easy-monetary policy as early as next week.】

item.title: 石油小幅上涨，高于需求预期
item.description: 油价在亚洲早盘交易中上涨，但由于市场在等待石油机构的月度报告，价格波动有限。【原文：Oil prices rose in early Asian trading, but price moves were limited as the market waited for monthly reports from oil agencies.】

item.title: 日本央行总裁上田略微降低了对经济的乐观程度
item.description: 日本央行行长上田一夫（Kazuo Ueda）周二表示，日本经济正在复苏，但也显示出一些疲软迹象，与1月份相比，上田一夫的评估略显暗淡，这与最近一系列疲软的消费数据有关。【原文：Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda said on Tuesday the economy was recovering but also showing some signs of weakness, offering a slightly bleaker assessment than in January in a nod to a recent batch of soft data on consumption.】

item.title: 中国小米开始交付首款电动车型，股价飙升
item.description: 中国小米公司周二表示，将于本月开始交付首款电动汽车（EV）SU7，在残酷的价格战中进军全球最大的汽车市场。【原文：China's Xiaomi said on Tuesday it will start deliveries of its first electric vehicle (EV) model SU7 this month, venturing into the world's largest auto market amid a brutal price war.】

item.title: 新西兰称扣押了拉美航空波音 787 的黑匣子
item.description: 新西兰交通事故调查委员会周二表示，在造成 50 多人受伤的事故发生后，该委员会正在扣押拉塔姆航空公司一架波音 787 飞机的驾驶舱语音记录器和飞行数据记录器。【原文：New Zealand's Transport Accident Investigation Commission said on Tuesday it was seizing the cockpit voice recorder and flight data recorder of a LATAM Airlines Boeing 787 after an incident that left more than 50 people injured.】

item.title: 美元保持警惕；日本央行的猜测使日元继续受到支撑
item.description: 周二，在当天晚些时候将公布的美国关键通胀数据公布之前，美元大体持稳，而日元则在一个月高点附近走强，原因是人们对日本央行最早可能在下周退出负利率的预期不断升温。【原文：The dollar held broadly steady on Tuesday ahead of key U.S. inflation data due later in the day, while the yen firmed near a one-month high on mounting expectations the Bank of Japan could exit negative interest rates as early as next week.】

item.title: 穆迪启动评级审查，中国万科港股低开 1
item.description: 穆迪（Moody's）表示，中国万科的房地产公司评级将被考虑降至垃圾级后，该公司股价周二在香港开盘下跌了 1%。【原文：China Vanke's shares are have opened down 1% in Hong Kong on Tuesday after Moody's said the property company's rating would now be considered for junk status.】

item.title: Blackwells 称迪士尼未披露 ValueAct 的资金管理职责
item.description: Blackwells Capital 周一表示，华特迪士尼没有告诉股东 ValueAct Capital Management 投资了这家美国娱乐业巨头超过 3.5 亿美元的养老基金资产，这造成了利益冲突。【原文：Blackwells Capital said on Monday Walt Disney failed to tell shareholders that ValueAct Capital Management had invested more than $350 million of the U.S. entertainment giant's pension fund assets, creating a conflict of interest.】

item.title: 纽约市银行完成 10 亿美元注资交易
item.description: 纽约社区银行（New York Community Bancorp）周一表示，该公司已完成上周与一个投资者团体达成的 10 亿美元注资交易，并计划向股东提交普通股一拆三的反向拆股方案。【原文：New York Community Bancorp said on Monday it had closed the $1 billion capital infusion deal that was agreed last week with an investor group and plans to submit one-for-three reverse stock split of its common stock to shareholders.】

item.title: 新西兰航空公司暂停奥克兰至芝加哥直飞航班服务
item.description: 新西兰航空公司（Air New Zealand）周二表示，由于罗尔斯-罗伊斯公司（Rolls-Royce）的遄达1000（Trent 1000）发动机在可用性方面一直面临挑战，该公司计划从今年3月31日至10月25日暂停奥克兰至芝加哥的直飞航线。【原文：Air New Zealand said on Tuesday it plans to pause its Auckland to Chicago non-stop service from March 31 to Oct. 25 this year due to ongoing challenges with the availability of serviceable Rolls-Royce Trent 1000 engines.】

item.title: 美国法官将于 8 月 26 日审理联邦贸易委员会对克罗格阿尔伯森交易的质疑
item.description: 美国联邦地区法官阿德里安娜-尼尔森（Adrienne Nelson）周一将 8 月 26 日定为美国联邦贸易委员会（Federal Trade Commission）申请初步禁令的听证会开始日，该禁令旨在阻止连锁超市克罗格（Kroger）斥资 246 亿美元收购较小竞争对手阿尔伯森（Albertsons）的交易。【原文：U.S. District Judge Adrienne Nelson on Monday set Aug. 26 as the start of a hearing on the Federal Trade Commission's bid for a preliminary injunction to block supermarket chain Kroger's $24.6 billion deal to buy smaller rival Albertsons .】

item.title: 沃尔格林就纽约对其抬高婴儿配方奶粉价格的指控达成和解
item.description: 纽约州总检察长莱蒂娅-詹姆斯（Letitia James）指控沃尔格林在雅培实验室召回导致全国范围内婴儿配方奶粉短缺后，于 2022 年严重抬高了至少 20 种婴儿配方奶粉的价格，沃尔格林已就这一指控达成和解。【原文：Walgreens has settled charges by New York Attorney General Letitia James that the pharmacy chain grossly inflated prices on at least 20 infant formula products in 2022 after a recall by Abbott Labs led to a nationwide shortage.】

item.title: 早间竞价：股市再次走低，印度CPI即将公布
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 泰森食品公司将关闭拥有 1200 名工人的爱荷华州猪肉工厂
item.description: 泰森食品公司（Tyson Foods）周一表示，将永久关闭位于爱荷华州佩里（Perry）的一家猪肉工厂，届时将裁员约 1200 人。【原文：Tyson Foods will permanently close a pork plant in Perry, Iowa, the meatpacker said on Monday, eliminating jobs for about 1,200 workers.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，默多克的新闻集团希望与竞争对手联合竞购《每日电讯报
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周一援引知情人士的话报道，鲁珀特-默多克（Rupert Murdoch）的新闻集团和《每日邮报》的所有者已经就阿联酋支持的投资基金 RedBird IMI 联合收购《每日电讯报》的可能性进行了谈判。【原文：Rupert Murdoch's News Corp and the owner of the Daily Mail have held talks about a potential joint takeover of the Telegraph alongside the UAE-backed investment fund RedBird IMI, Bloomberg News reported on Monday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 甲骨文季度营收不及预期
item.description: 甲骨文公司周一公布的第三季度营收不及预期，原因是经济前景不明朗和云计算行业的激烈竞争影响了对其服务的需求。【原文：Oracle missed third-quarter revenue estimates on Monday, as an uncertain economic outlook and strong competition in the cloud-computing industry weighed on demand for its services.】

item.title: 美国运输部长希望波音在 737 MAX 调查中与司法部和 NTSB 合作
item.description: 美国运输部长皮特-巴蒂吉格（Pete Buttigieg）周一表示，他希望波音公司能配合司法部和国家运输安全委员会对阿拉斯加航空公司737 MAX 9型客机1月5日空中紧急事故的调查。【原文：U.S. Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg said Monday he expects Boeing to cooperate in investigations by the Justice Department and National Transportation Safety Board into the Alaska Airlines 737 MAX 9 mid-air emergency on Jan. 5.】

item.title: 福特在美国进口关税逃税案中支付 3.65 亿美元
item.description: 福特汽车公司将支付 3.65 亿美元，以解决美国指控其违反联邦关税法，对数十万辆 Transit Connect 汽车进行错误分类并低报价值的问题。【原文：Ford Motor will pay $365 million to resolve U.S. allegations it violated a federal tariff law by misclassifying and understating the value of hundreds of thousands of its Transit Connect vehicles.】
